intro: Guevaria vargasii, commonly known as the Vargas's guevaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its ornamental value. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
